net.kuujo.vertigo.component

Interface ComponentContext<T extends ComponentContext<T>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Context<T>, net.kuujo.vertigo.util.serialization.JsonSerializable, net.kuujo.vertigo.util.Observable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModuleContext, VerticleContext

    public interface ComponentContext<T extends ComponentContext<T>>
extends Context<T>
    A component context which contains information regarding each component instance within a single network component.

    Contexts are immutable as they are constructed once a network has been deployed. The component context is not actually used by any Vertigo object, but is a wrapper around multiple InstanceContext instances, with each instance representing an instance of the component - a Vert.x verticle or module.

    See ModuleContext and VerticleContext for module and verticle specific configuration options respectively.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman
